hints.content: To divide a shape in half, we divide the whole into **$2$ equal parts**.

This square is divided into $2$ pieces, but the pieces are not equal in size:  

![A square with 1 angled line dividing it into 2 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5099abed14ce5eee03154aa09bd0c356300dbd8e)

This square is not divided into $2$ pieces: 
 
![A square with 1 horizontal line and 1 vertical line dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/06216a7934098a24ac8906e4e89fba83f1e366fd)

These squares are divided into halves:  

![A square with 1 diagonal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/92c3d71a0e846dd51c9112499222e02899f66fa4)

![A square with 1 vertical line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4e092c9a6ceed10ff65dcd4b586e4deac5c7533b)

question.content:
**Which squares are divided into halves?**

choices.content: ![A square with 1 horizontal line and 1 vertical line dividing it into 4 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/06216a7934098a24ac8906e4e89fba83f1e366fd)
![A square with 1 diagonal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/92c3d71a0e846dd51c9112499222e02899f66fa4)
![A square with 1 angled line dividing it into 2 unequal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5099abed14ce5eee03154aa09bd0c356300dbd8e)
![A square with 1 vertical line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4e092c9a6ceed10ff65dcd4b586e4deac5c7533b)
